name: Pyrocatechol
Reason: The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two hydroxyl (-OH) groups on the benzene ring, as in pyrocatechol, significantly affects the melting point due to increased hydrogen bonding. However, a 50 degrees Celsius increase for each hydroxyl group seems excessive. Typically, a hydroxyl group can be expected to increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, but the effect should be evaluated more conservatively. A range of 20-30 degrees Celsius increase per hydroxyl group is more reasonable. Thus, the combined contribution of two hydroxyl groups would be approximately 40-60 degrees Celsius.
